title: Tastiera
content: Buona sera, Da ieri 3/8 ,mi pare dopo un vs. aggiornamento, quando utilizzo qualunque programma con il vostro browser la tastiera riproduce caratteri e numeri casuali anziché ciò che viene digitato, ho dovuto migrare si un altro browser per potere lavorare. Il problema si manifesta con due tastiere wireless diverse che funzionano perfettamente fuori da firefox. Utilizzo w10. Prima di ieri non ho mai avuto problemi e non ho fatto nessuna implementazione o modifica di recente. Penso proprio derivi dal vs ultimo aggiornamento. La funzione ripristino non ha dato risultati. Se avete suggerimenti grazie. Guido Frassoldati
creator: guido.frassoldati

title: Firefox cierra mis sesiones de gmail
content: Al cerrar Firefox , también cierra mis sesiones iniciadas en google , por lo que tengo que volver a escribir el correo y la contraseña cada vez que vuelvo a abrir el navegador (lo cual es terriblemente incomodo ) ya explore todas las opciones , volví a instalar Firefox, desactive la pestaña "Eliminar cookies y datos del sitio cuando cierre Firefox" pero aun sigo con el problema , todos los tutoriales relacionado a este problema enfocan a que esta ultima opción es la que resolvería el problema pero no es mi caso . A alguien se le ocurre como puedo solucionarlo ? o si hay alguna manera de contactar con soporte de Firefox .Gracias

title: I Don't See the Option for Recommended by Pocket on my Firefox
content:
I am in the United States. My machine is on Windows 22H2 (OS Build) 19045.3208. My version of FFox is 116.0 (64-bit).

My firefox was getting very booged down after months of usage and I complete uninstalled and reinstalled, and now Recommend by Pocket does not show up either on my Home Page, or as an option to add it.

Googling around, the two most common fixes I have seen is to fix this are:

1) Click the Personalize button in the upper right corner of the new tab page and toggle Recommended by Pocket to on, but the option does not appear there. See attached screenshot. 2) Type about:config in address bar, then browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.feeds.section.topstories, and set to true. This was already in effect. See attached screenshot.

Anything else I can try to enable it? I really like it and I miss it.
creator: firefox.chuck

title: Want PDFs to open in Firefox except when they're shipping labels downloaded from eBay
content:
I have a really niche case which there's probably no solution for but I want to ask just in case:

I'm happy with the behaviour of Firefox opening PDFs as it does currently except in one case: eBay shipping labels. When I buy a shipping label on eBay it presents two buttons: one is open and one is download. When I click download it both downloads and opens in a new tab. I can disable Firefox opening PDFs to stop that but then that affects my experience every time I try to open a PDF everywhere else.

Is there some way that I can stop Firefox from opening PDFs but only when they're opened from links that look like this? https://www.ebay.co.uk/ship/single/api/label-service/label/4049d9b7-5563-47e9-b181-6d0f50a6101e/download?printable=true&pageFormat=RAW&useImageFormat=false&attachment=true&consumer=LABELUI_SINGLE

title: Can we stop locking threads?
content:
It is very frustrating that old topics are locked. They pop-up in search but then they can't be updated when they are outdated and are forever noise in the Internet.

For example this post: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1376551

It is incorrect. Now it is possible to revert to the previous useful behavior from `about:config` -> `browser.download.start_downloads_in_tmp_dir`

But I can't update neither the support thread, nor the reddit thread because both are locked. And I can't save other users from half an hour search.

I understand that many users tend to reuse threads incorrectly. But this is not much if at all harder to moderate than low quality new threads. It will be much more useful to allow editing old threads. Even if the new comment requires a moderator approval.

For example I try to post a comment, it warns me that this is an old thread and if I'm not adding an update because of product improvements, I should ask a new question. And that a moderator should approve my post.

Only then it adds to some moderator queue.

I think it is apparent from other forums and sites like the stackexchange bunch that editing old questions is often very valuable.
creator: akostadinov

title: Search Engine
content:
Hi,

I heard firefox was a safer browsing experience so I've decided to make the move over to here :)

I just have one question though. It says in my Firefox settings that my search engine is Google. On my Google account I had specific settings on for location tracking, cookies etc. When it says it's using Google as a search engine, is there a way I can be 'signed in' to my Google account (the way you could be signed in to Google if you were using Safari on an iPhone) so that those settings will still be on while using Firefox? I'd like to continue not allowing Google to track my location and other preferences I had when I used Chrome. Or if I use Youtube in Firefox that I'd be automatically signed in to my Youtube account.

I hope this makes sense!

Thanks
creator: taradoodle3

title: Finestra "Gestione Certificati" troppo grande
content:
Buongiorno, ieri ho importato alucni certificati che mi servono per lavoro da alcune Card con un lettore HAMLET NFC. Mi è successa una cosa strana: andando in: Impostazioni - Privacy - Mostra Certificati, la finestra che appare sopra che tiene memorizzati i certificati installati su Firefox è diventata enorme, tanto da non farmi vedere nulla se non il Dispositivo che li ha generati, ma niente altro si visualizza che mi dica le carattestiche di tali certificati. Ho provato in ogni modo a ridurre tale finstra sovraimpressa, ma sembra che l'unico modo per ridimensionarla sia l' angolo in basso a destra, che purtoppo io non riesco a vedere, ne a prendere in altro modo. Chiedo a Voi, se esiste un metodo alternativo, anche con i comandi dalla tastiera o magari qualche tool, che permette il ridimensionamento, senza dover per forza disinstallare e reinstallare Firefox.

Ringrazio da ora quanti di Voi mi risponderanno.
creator: massimantonio
